paragraph: CHAPTER XII. BACK AGAIN AT WHY.
KIS-SMEE was overjoyed to get out of the train, and eagerly strained at the chain which his Majesty had affixed to his collar, in his endeavor to get through the barrier.
tokens: overjoy get train strain chain affix collar endeavor get barrier

paragraph: The porter, however, who pretended not to know us, demanded our tickets.
tokens: porter pretend know demand ticket

paragraph: “It’s all right,” said his Majesty, smilingly. “I’m the Wallypug, you know.”
tokens: right say know

paragraph: “Nonsense,” said the porter. “The Wallypug was ugly enough, goodness knows, but he hadn’t a _blue_ face like you; besides, Wallypug or no Wallypug, you don’t get through here without a ticket, I can tell you.”
tokens: nonsense say porter ugly goodness know face get ticket tell

paragraph: Here was a pretty pickle. We had not thought in the least about tickets, and in fact had no idea that any would be required.
tokens: pretty pickle think least ticket fact have idea require

paragraph: “I certainly shan’t let you pass the barrier without,” said the porter, in answer to our explanations.
tokens: let pass barrier say porter answer explanation

paragraph: “But what are we to do?” asked the Wallypug. “Can’t we pay at this end?”
tokens: do ask pay end

paragraph: “Certainly not. My instructions are to demand a ticket of every one passing this barrier, and unless you give me one you cannot go through.”
tokens: instruction demand ticket one pass barrier give go

paragraph: “But I tell you we haven’t any. Can’t you tell us what to do?”
tokens: tell tell do

paragraph: “Go back for them, I should say,” said the porter, yawning unconcernedly. “Now then, one thing or another. Are you going to give me the tickets or not?”
tokens: go say say porter yawn thing go give ticket

paragraph: “How can we give them to you if we haven’t any?” demanded the Wallypug. The porter slammed the door to impatiently, and went a little way up the platform, turning around to call out warningly, “If we find any suspicious-looking characters hanging about the station premises we shoot them.”
tokens: give demand porter slam door go little way platform turn call find suspicious look character hang station premise shoot

paragraph: [THE PORTER DEMANDED OUR TICKETS.]
tokens: demand tickets

paragraph: “What nonsense!” cried the Wallypug, rattling and kicking the gate. “We can’t stop here all day. Let’s call the station-master. Hi! hi! station-master!” he shouted.
tokens: nonsense cry rattling kick gate stop day let call station master station master shout

paragraph: No one answered for a few minutes, but eventually a door some little distance up the platform opened, and the old station-master made his appearance, puffing and blowing, and followed by the porter, carrying a huge blunderbuss.
tokens: answer few minute door little distance platform open old station master make appearance puffing blow follow porter carry huge blunderbuss

paragraph: “Now then, what’s all this noise about?” he demanded.
tokens: noise demand

paragraph: “We want to get out, if you please,” said the Wallypug.
tokens: want get say

paragraph: “Where are your tickets,” demanded the station-master.
tokens: ticket demand station master

paragraph: “We are very sorry,” I began in explanation.
tokens: sorry begin explanation

paragraph: “Hold your tongue, and speak when you are spoken to,” interrupted the station-master.
tokens: hold tongue speak speak interrupt station master

paragraph: “Where are your tickets?”
tokens: ticket

paragraph: “They haven’t any,” explained the porter officiously. “They are trying to defraud the company.”
tokens: explain porter try defraud company

paragraph: “H’m, funny-looking lot of people, too,” remarked the station-master. “Who are they, do you know?”
tokens: funny look lot person remark station master know

paragraph: “That,” said the porter, pointing to his Majesty, “says he is the Wallypug.”
tokens: say porter point say

paragraph: “What! _that_ color!” objected the station-master. “The Wallypug! Indeed, what nonsense!”
tokens: color object station master nonsense

paragraph: “But, indeed, I am the Wallypug,” declared his Majesty, “and we turned this color after we drank the tea, you know.”
tokens: declare turn color drink tea know

paragraph: “Turned blue through drinking tea!” said the station-master incredulously.
tokens: turn blue drinking tea say station master

paragraph: “Ha! ha! a _likely_ story,” laughed the porter derisively.
tokens: story laugh porter

paragraph: “Perhaps it will wear off in time,” said the Wallypug, “like being sunburnt does.”
tokens: wear time say sunburnt

paragraph: “Very well then, you had better stop here till it does,” said the station-master. “Look here!” he cried, turning to the porter, “you stop here at the barrier, and don’t let them through until they have turned a respectable color, and you can recognize them.”
tokens: good stop say station master look cry turn porter stop barrier let turn respectable color recognize

paragraph: “But it may take weeks,” began his Majesty.
tokens: take week begin

paragraph: “Hold your tongue!” said the station-master sharply. “If you have any nonsense with them, shoot them,” he added to the porter, depositing the blunderbuss beside the barrier, and going back to the other end of the platform.
tokens: hold tongue say station master have nonsense shoot add porter deposit blunderbuss barrier go other end platform

paragraph: Whatever we should have done I cannot think, if just at that moment the porter’s wife had not put her head out of the signal-box and called to him to “come in at once and mind the baby,” while she “did a little shopping.”
tokens: do think moment porter wife put head signal box call come mind baby do little shopping

paragraph: “But he’s on duty, ma’am,” expostulated the station-master.
tokens: duty ma’am expostulate station master

paragraph: “I don’t care anything about _that;_ you come in at once, Bill,” shouted the woman, and the porter meekly left the barrier and disappeared within the signal-box.
tokens: care come shout woman porter leave barrier disappear signal box

paragraph: Of course we all rushed through the gate at once, and the station-master catching sight of Kis-Smee, who had meanwhile slipped his chain, fled up the platform in dismay.
tokens: course rush gate station master catching sight slip chain flead platform dismay

paragraph: Kis-Smee, evidently thinking him fair game, started off in pursuit, and it was not till the station-master had bolted into his office and locked the door that we could get him to come back to our call.
tokens: think fair game start pursuit station master bolt office lock door get come call

paragraph: [FLED UP THE PLATFORM IN DISMAY.]
tokens: fled platfor dismay

paragraph: So soon as we got into the street we met the Turtle and the Pelican, walking arm-in-arm, and each smoking a cigarette.
tokens: get street meet walk arm arm smoke cigarette

paragraph: “Hullo, Wallypug!” exclaimed the Pelican. “Why, we thought you were at Wei-hai-wei.”
tokens: exclaim think

paragraph: “Wer-har-wei, you mean,” laughed his Majesty.
tokens: mean laugh

paragraph: “It’s all the same,” announced the Pelican. “Well, how have you been getting on?”
tokens: same announce get

paragraph: His Majesty explained as briefly as possible the adventures we had passed through, and then inquired how affairs were progressing at Why.
tokens: explain possible adventure pass inquire affair progress

paragraph: “Oh, not very well, I’m afraid,” said the Pelican. “You see, there has been no one to take the lead since you’ve been away. We tried a Republican form of government, and elected Oom-Hi as president, but he became so extravagant—wanted a new top-hat every day, and insisted on a gilded coach to ride in; and at last we caught him tampering with the public funds, so we had to dismiss him. Have you heard about Broncho?”
tokens: afraid say see be take lead try republican form government elect president become extravagant want new top hat day insist gilded coach ride last catch tamper public fund have dismiss hear

paragraph: “No,” said his Majesty.
tokens: say

paragraph: “Well, it didn’t answer as a cough mixture, so Oom-Hi turned it into a patent meat extract, and called it Vimbril, and it killed ever so many people.”
tokens: answer cough mixture turn patent meat extract call kill many person

paragraph: “Indeed!” exclaimed the Wallypug, anxiously. “Any one I know?”
tokens: exclaim one know

paragraph: “Madame and a few other folk,” was the reply; “and the Doctor-in-Law is not expected to recover.”
tokens: few other folk reply expect recover

paragraph: “Good gracious! Why, we thought them at the other end of the world. However did they get back to Why again?”
tokens: good gracious think other end world get

paragraph: “Oh, they sent us a cablegram when they got to China, and we let down an enormously long rope and pulled them up the shute again, you know. But it was a very long journey, and they had nothing to eat on the way. So as soon as we hauled them up we gave them each a large dose of Vimbril. Madame expired at once,” he added, with a sob.
tokens: send cablegram get let long rope pull shute know long journey have eat way haul give large dose expire add sob

paragraph: The tears were streaming down the Turtle’s nose as he sympathetically joined in the Pelican’s weeping.
tokens: tear stream nose join weeping

paragraph: “What about the Doctor-in-Law?” inquired his Majesty, solicitously.
tokens: inquire

paragraph: “Oh, he has a very strong constitution, you know, and he may pull through. We’ve got him back at the palace in his old quarters.”
tokens: have strong constitution know pull get palace old quarter

paragraph: “Poor fellow! Poor fellow!” said the Wallypug, sympathetically. “Let’s go and see what we can do for him.”
tokens: poor fellow poor fellow say let go see do

paragraph: I thought this very kind of his Majesty, considering all he had suffered through the Doctor-in-Law’s ingratitude; but the good-hearted little fellow was full of sympathy, and hurried towards the palace with all speed.
tokens: think very kind consider suffer ingratitude good hearted little fellow full sympathy hurry palace speed
